info.game_comments:
Frank Epstein game 1.  
3 clues missing in Double Jeopardy.

(1, 1).clue: Items that sell as soon as you put them on the shelf "go like" these

(2, 1).clue: A tent is their summer home as their winter home, an igloo, is hard to maintain

(3, 1).clue: A knight used different types of these: a palfrey for travel, a fast courser for battle

(4, 1).clue: Charlotte Rae went from housekeeper to housemother when "Different Strokes" spun off this series

(5, 1).clue: The explosive trinitrotoluene is commonly abbreviated this

(6, 1).clue: Form yeast dough into a circle, spread with tomato sauce, top with mozzarella, bake

(1, 2).clue: To start an engine by short-circuiting the ignition

(2, 2).clue: Each summer this landmark in New Mexico's Guadalupe Mts. is home to hundreds of thousands of bats

(3, 2).clue: A youth being trained as a knight, or his haircut

(4, 2).clue: "The Simpsons" got their own series after being featured as short segments on this FOX comedy

(5, 2).clue: Like caterpillars, spiders have spinning glands which produce this fiber

(6, 2).clue: Mash avocado, add onion, lemon juice & a small bit of tomato

(1, 3).clue: A controversial issue you'd rather not touch; tuber or not tuber, that's the question

(2, 3).clue: The largest herd of these in the world heads to the Pribilofs each summer to breed

(3, 3).clue: In most legends he's the son of Ban & the lover of Queen Guinevere

(4, 3).clue: This sitcom starring Cloris Leachman was the 2nd spin-off from "The Mary Tyler Moore Show"

(5, 3).clue: The simplest form of spectroscope incorporates one of these objects to split the spectrum

(6, 3).clue: Dip slices of bread into an egg-milk mixture, saute in butter until browned

(1, 4).clue: To show off by performing risky maneuvers on a surfboard

(2, 4).clue: Tanglewood in the Berkshires is the summer home for this city's symphony orchestra

(3, 4).clue: Cervantes satirized these knights who wandered around the world in search of adventure

(4, 4).clue: Lindsay Wagner became "The Bionic Woman" after playing Lee Majors' love interest on this series

(5, 4).clue: A pyroclastic rock is formed from fragments thrown into the air by one of these

(6, 4).clue: Heat pitted cherries with their juice, flambe with brandy, serve over vanilla ice cream

(1, 5).clue: The building in which fruit is forced to grow out of its normal season

(2, 5).clue: During the 1830s the British used this city, where it's always tea time, as the summer capital of Bengal

(3, 5).clue: Because of a magic potion, this champion dragon killer was in love with Aunt Iseult

(4, 5).clue: In 1977 Abe Vigoda appeared simultaneously on "Barney Miller" & this spin-off

(5, 5).clue: Some scientists believe that the spiral tusk on this Arctic whale helps it attract mates

(6, 5).clue: Slice peeled potatoes as thin as possible, soak in cold water, deep fry in vegetable oil

(1, 1).clue: In 1797 Andre-Jacques Garnerin made the 1st parachute jump from one of these

(2, 1).clue: Alexander Pushkin's "Motsart I Salieri" was the forerunner of this 1979 play

(3, 1).clue: The sailing ship Balclutha, which serves as a museum, is anchored near this wharf

(4, 1).clue: MacPAINT is a graphics program developed for this Apple computer

(6, 1).clue: Throughout the 1880s, Holmes lived in a 2-bedroom apartment at this London address

(1, 2).clue: In July 1976 it became the 1st supersonic transport to provide passenger service

(2, 2).clue: As a schoolboy, Laurence Olivier played the role of Kate in this Shakespeare play

(3, 2).clue: Since its founding there in 1850, this clothing manufacturer has sold over 2 billion pairs of jeans

(4, 2).clue: Piece of computer hardware on which you'd be likely to find a daisy wheel

(6, 2).clue: Holmes said this musical instrument was worth 500 guineas but he paid 55 shillings for it

(1, 3).clue: In 1986 Dick Rutan & Jeana Yeager made the 1st nonstop world flight without doing this

(2, 3).clue: The 1920s play "And So to Bed" was based on the life of this diarist

(3, 3).clue: This district was named for the semaphore station erected there in 1850

(4, 3).clue: These rigid disks have much greater storage capacity than floppy disks

(6, 3).clue: Holmes described this archrival as a "Napoleon of Crime" & "One of the Great Brains of the Century"

(1, 4).clue: 3 1/2 years after his North Pole flight, he made the 1st flight over the South Pole

(2, 4).clue: In 1981 Elizabeth Taylor starred in a revival of this playwright's "The Little Foxes"

(3, 4).clue: San Francisco's first woman mayor, she took office in 1978 upon the death of George Moscone

(4, 4).clue: All modern PCs are this type of computer, as opposed to analog computers

(5, 4).clue: Known by this acronym, the Soviet-U.S. accord signed July 31, 1991 was 9 years in the making

(6, 4).clue: This 1st Sherlock Holmes adventure was published in "Beeton's Christmas Annual" in 1887

(1, 5).clue: Though better known for his work with helicopters, he also built & flew the 1st 4-engine plane

(2, 5).clue: The 1990 Tony Award for Best Musical went to this play set in 1940s L.A.

(3, 5).clue: With 8 consecutive very sharp turns, it's called the world's most winding street

(4, 5).clue: Producer of 1-2-3, this company's name is the Hindu symbol of enlightenment

(5, 5).clue: Robert Stockton helped the American Colonization Soc. with an 1821 treaty to secure what is now this African country

(6, 5).clue: He was Sherlock's older brother by 7 years

(0, 0).clue: She was granted free use of the mails in December 1963
